actions.text: Referred to the House Committee on the Judiciary.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Immigration and Border Security.

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Immigration and Border Security

official_title: To direct the Secretary of Homeland Security to allow aliens having status as an E-2 nonimmigrant by reason of a change of nonimmigrant classification made in the United States to re-enter the United States after a trip abroad without obtaining a new visa.

summary.text:
Investors Need Clear Laws with Uniform Direction for E-2 Status Holders Act or the INCLUDE Act - Allows aliens having E-2 (treaty investor) nonimmigrant status by reason of a change of nonimmigrant classification made in the United States to re-enter the United States after a trip abroad without requesting or obtaining a new visa.

States that there shall be no limit on the number of such re-entries during the period in which the alien lawfully holds such status.

titles.title: Investors Need Clear Laws with Uniform Direction for E-2 Status Holders Act

To direct the Secretary of Homeland Security to allow aliens having status as an E-2 nonimmigrant by reason of a change of nonimmigrant classification made in the United States to re-enter the United States after a trip abroad without obtaining a new visa.
